result.execSummary:
The defendant Breon Monte Keys was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with count two. Credit for 18 days.   The first six months straight time.  Remainder can be at the Day Reporting Center with huber.  
Last three months only with electronic release.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; but concurrent with count one.  Credit for 18 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breon Monte Keys

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.

Defendant Breon Monte Keys in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Katherine Seelow for Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
ENTRY MADE WITH DUPLICATE FILE.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 18 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but CONCURRENT to Count 2.  First 6 months straight time, remainder can be at the day reporting center with Huber.  Last 3 months only with electronic release.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 18 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence but CONCURRENT to Count 1.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 09/10/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test. Parties instructed to report to Branch 22 immediately for bail review.  Defendant absconded from Justice Point, defense attorney is unable to appear in court.  Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Breon Monte Keys in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  David Behm for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the "Second and Subsequent Offense" enhancer in Count 1 is DISMISSED.  As to Counts 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200.00 of $500.00 posted) ad

Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Witkowiak.  Court contacted Judge Watt's clerk for the next court date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/17/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 22, in room 608 of the courthouse.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Breon Monte Keys in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Breon Monte Keys in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
